author: andschwa
body: Per @lzybkr, the host will need to support stdin/stdout scenarios.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: AFAICT the ConsoleHost uses a really old `ConsoleControl` class to get stdin/stdout. Since these are available as streams in [`System.Console`](https://dotnet.github.io/api/System.Console.html#System_Console_OpenStandardInput) even on .NET Core, this should pretty easy to fix.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I'll probably try to do this in #939.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: This is required to fix the `powershell -file -` problem on OpenSSH. _Technically_ this is a breaking change, but only in scenarios where you don't close stdin or you expect a prompt after piping stdin into PowerShell.

title: Supported redirected stdin/stdout in host
